did.abstract: Working papers of Roland Carreker, a General Electric engineer, researcher and manager specializing in metallurgy and metal procurement.

note.p: Creation of this finding aid was supported by a grant from the Center for History of Physics, American Institute of Physics.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

bioghist.p: Roland Carreker received his BS in 1945 and his MS in 1947, both from from the University in Illinois. He joined General Electric upon graduating and through a GE educational program he received his Ph.D.in metallurgical engineering from the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in 1955. During his career at GE he served as a Research Associate specializing in metals and metal fatigue, and as a Manager of Materials Resource Analysis involved with materials procurement and forecasting the price and availability of metals.

scopecontent.p: The Carreker papers contain a mixture of the working papers of Roland Carreker. The focus is on his work with copper and the copper dip forming process, about which Carreker had several patents.
